situation.title: Possibilities and obligations of foreigners when entering the CZ
situation.meta_description: Rules and recommendations for entering the territory of the Czech Republic.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

 Foreigners are not allowed to come to the Czech Republic for reasons other than necessary.   

Necessary reasons include a trip to work and to do business, a profession, a trip back to their places of residence, a necessary trip to family or close relatives, a trip to leave the Czech Republic, participation in a wedding or funeral, participation in education, including internships and exams. More informations can be found at current measures

From 5.2.2021, the new rules of entry into the Czech Republic apply. Without any conditions, it is possible to travel to the Czech Republic only from countries that are on the list of countries with a low risk of infection. If you have been in a country with a medium, high or very high risk of infection for more than 12 hours in the last 14 days (this category includes all countries not listed above), the following rules apply to you. 

Journey from countries with a medium risk of infection (orange):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or an PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic.

Journey from countries with a high risk of infection (red):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or an PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic.
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

Journey from countries with a very high risk of infection (dark red):

  1. Fill in the arrival form before entering the Czech Republic.
  2. Undergo an antigen test no later than 24 hours or an PCR test no later than 72 hours before the trip to the Czech Republic.
  3. Within 5 days of arrival in the Czech Republic, undergo a PCR test and submit the result to the appropriate hygiene station. Until then, remain in quarantine.

There are exceptions to these conditions, which you will find in the current measure. For travel from all three groups of countries (orange, red, dark red), it is mandatory to wear an FFP2 respirator or at least a medical veil for 10 days after arrival in the Czech Republic.

The exact conditions for entry into the territory of the Czech Republic, including exceptions, can be found in English clearly in the table of the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic.

We also recommend you to check the conditions of accommodation.

In case of doubts or questions, please call the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic: +420 974 801 801  (Mon - Thu: 8:00 - 16:00 and Fri: 8:00 - 12:00). Or by e-mail: cestovani.covid19@mvcr.cz. Information is available in Czech and English language.
